entry.et: Middle English, from Anglo-French, from Latin medicina, from feminine of medicinus of a physician, from medicus

def.dt: :a substance or preparation used in treating disease
:the science and art dealing with the maintenance of health and the prevention, alleviation, or cure of disease
:the branch of medicine concerned with the nonsurgical treatment of disease
:a substance (as a drug or potion) used to treat something other than disease
:an object held in traditional American Indian belief to give control over natural or magical forces
:a heavy usually large ball used especially in conditioning and strengthening exercises
:a priestly healer or sorcerer especially among the American Indians :shaman
:a traveling show using entertainers to attract a crowd among which remedies or nostrums are sold
river 120 miles (193 kilometers) S Wyoming flowing into North Platte River
mountains N Colorado & S Wyoming in the Rockies; highest Medicine Bow Peak (in Wyoming) 12,013 feet (3662 m)
city Canada in SE Alberta pop 56,997
:any of various systems of healing or treating disease (as chiropractic, homeopathy, or faith healing) not included in the traditional medical curricula of the United States and Britain
:any of the practices (as acupuncture) of alternative medicine accepted and utilized by mainstream medical practitioners
